weeklyTopNews.title: Vic set to open up earlier than planned
weeklyTopNews.summary: Victoria recorded one new case and no deaths overnight. The 14-day rolling average for new cases now stands at 6.4. State Premier Daniel Andrews said the state was well-placed to ease more restrictions sooner than expected.

weeklyTopNews.title: Tasmania may open to NSW in early November if coronavirus cases remain low
weeklyTopNews.summary: State Premier Peter Gutwein is hopeful Tasmania will reopen to NSW in early November. He added that he will be providing an update on Friday or Monday.

weeklyTopNews.title: NSW records five new locally acquired coronavirus cases as Oran Park cluster expands
weeklyTopNews.summary: NSW recorded 7 new cases in total, with 2 being in hotel quarantine. The other five have been attributed to the Oran Park cluster which now has 18 cases.

weeklyTopNews.title: Victoria set to ease lockdown rules after it records two new cases and no deaths
weeklyTopNews.summary: The numbers are Victoria's lowest daily increase since June. Melbourne's 14 day rolling average now sits at 8.7 cases.

weeklyTopNews.title: NSW halts easing of restrictions after recording 11 new locally-acquired cases
weeklyTopNews.summary: NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian announced 13 new cases of coronavirus in the state overnight including 11 locally-acquired cases. The number has caused the state government to halt its plans for easing restrictions.
